intro: Hieracium fuscocinereum subsp. pycnodon, commonly known as the dense-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its clustered, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies pycnodon is distinguished by its dense, compact growth habit and reduced leaf size compared to other members of the species. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. The plant has small, alternate leaves and produces numerous disc flowers that attract pollinators like bees and flies.
